column2: "Lots of tiny
column3: similar shaped and colored pieces are making this puzzle a difficult project.  However

column2: "Dave was the first one in my collection.  I have since added Stuart and Tim

column2: "In a recent review
column3: I complained about the lack of sturdiness of modern toys.  However
column4: this play house is sturdy and seems as though it would provide many years of play to several generations of children.  The play house is also pretty
column5: and large enough that you could stuff a lot of things into it.The only complaint I have about this play house is the lack of pirate-related stuff to go into it.  You do get some blocky figures and cannons
column6: but no pirate treasure
column7: no steering wheel
column8: no little pirate swords
column9: or anything similar.  I suppose that if you were trying to give this play house to a small child
column10: the lack of small parts could be an advantage.  However
column11: if I were a small child
column12: I would be asking mom and dad for stuff to go into my pirate play house.If you are looking for a play house for a small boy or girl
column13: this play house is a winner from the perspective that it seems like it would take a lot of abuse.  On the flip side
column15: so you end up populating the play house with other toys you have.  This play house begs for some sort of add on feature or set(s) that allow a child to expand play possibilities.Enjoy!"

column2: "I've played this game both with strangers at a party and with close family members. It worked well both times
column3: but there a definitely cards in it that can incite some arguments if you happen to be playing with certain people who can't laugh at themselves a bit. I would recommend you get the expansions as they will help to keep the game fresh and give you the option to create your own cards. After a few plays with just the base set
column4: the same cards will eventually come up and the laughter can die down if you can't come up with fresh combos. It's a fun game though and I really enjoy it with my family especially."

column2: "They love the large size and all the different dinosaurs. It has been assembled over and over. Good quality too!"

column2: "Aptly named
column3: you and 3 others participate in a race to get the most victory points through building up your tableau of cards. Not to be mistaken for a space exploration game
column4: it still packs a lot of fun through simultaneous hidden action selection. I would liken it to a more complex version of 7 Wonders. It is also supported by multiple expansions. Quality of cards is quite good
column5: they are very durable and easily shuffled and do not need card sleeves."

column2: "What the other people have said about the wheels not rolling well on hard floors is true. And yes
column3: they don't even roll all that great on carpet either but well enough that you can push it and it will move a few feet. Has this affected my son's enjoyment of it? Sure doesn't seem like it. I bought this for him at about a year old. He's been playing with it for a year now and he still enjoys it. That (his enjoyment) being the point I have to give it five stars overall and I like that it was made in USA. He also is sometimes pretty rough with it and pushes down on it while zooming around the living room and it's help up
column4: the only "damage" to it are some cosmetic modifications he made to it courtesy of his crayola crayons (also made in USA)."

column2: "I suppose these guys are more fun if you have the ability to interact with more than one. He's cute but changes personality quite frequently without all the "personal" interaction. Probably would not buy again."
"This was a birthday gift for my four year old son. He loves to play hide and seek so we thought he would like this game. After reading all the wonderful reviews
column3: I was excited to order it for him. He has a birthday right after Christmas so finding something else for him is sometimes difficult. He liked it at first
column4: but really he hasn't played with it much since. I know the age recommendation is 6+ BUT my one and a half year old LOVES playing with them. At first
column5: she was a little scared of them when they made a noise but she got over it in a couple days. She brings them to me often as says "high" for me to hide them. The only thing negative I have to say is that it does take almost three minutes before they start to make noise as a hint for you to find them. I guess I just assumed it would have been faster. I actually hide them for my kids in the house and they forget about them and go about playing with other toys until they hear them
column6: then they go hunt. I guess the long wait time would be better if playing outside or with a bunch of kids who are hiding them and take a long time to finally pick a hiding spot. I can say that my daughter has dropped them A LOT on our tile floor and they are still working great
column7: so they definitely seem well made. Hopefully these will be more of a hit with my son once spring/summer is here and we can play with them outside."

column2: "This is a small table workbench where toddlers can take pieces in and out of
column3: or hammer into.  There is a booklet with some things that can be put together with the wooden pieces and screws that come with it

column2: "Got them earlier than expected and now its laughter and talk about the new bracelets that they need to make. Cannot get these in the stores because as soon as they come in they're sold out. That is why we went to Amazon to get them because we knew that Amazon would have them and we'd get them and no waiting for the stores to call and say we've got them and we end up paying $13.00 to get just 20 to 30 rubber bands and about 6 to 8 clips per package. Thank you Amazon and the people who supplied these rubber bands for our granddaughters. You're a life saver."
"This
column3: like most ThinkFun games
column4: is a solitary thinking game
column5: but my kids really like it.  To play
column6: you pick a card and set up the game pieces accordingly.  Your goal is to get your man from his starting location to the designated ending location.  He can walk along crates and tip them over to get to the next crate (the tipping is quite gratifying to the kids for some reason).  Once a crate is tipped over
column7: you can't move it
column8: although you may find yourself backtracking over it.  If you are stuck
column9: the answers are printed on the back of each card. When you are finished
column10: toss it into the handy storage bag until the next time you or your kids need an interesting diversion.It is not specifically an educational game
column11: but it does provides practice in visualization
column14: and thinking!I do wish there was an easy way to get replacement pieces.  We've lost a couple of crates
column15: but can still play most of the cards.All in all

column2: "This is far more than I had expected.  I thought it was a simple paint by numbers kind of thing with caked watercolors.  It's not that.  It's liquid watercolors with an eyedropper for precise control on how much goes into the pallet
column3: a good
column4: reusable plastic pallet with 20 compartments
column5: a piece of heavy watercolor paper for testing colors
column6: and three fabulous panels on heavy paper.The paintbrush is double sided
column7: which is odd but not horrible.The paints supplied are blue
column8: red
column9: purple (in the red family)
column11: and black.  Most purists say you don't need white -- just let the white of the paper through.  I'm a fan of white for when I want a pastel effect -- pink is not quite the same thing as pale red -- but that's very much a minority opinion.The paper feels like a smooth cold press.  That means it has more texture (and more grip) than a hot press
column12: but not so much texture that it becomes a design element in its own right.This can serve as both an arts and crafts hobby kit
column13: and as a serious introduction to the art of watercolor painting.  The instructions are well suited for a first lesson.  It's supposed to be for ages 8 - 13
column16: to be fun for teenagers and adults as well."

column2: "These 12 cars add some fun to the tower. 2 cars just isn't enough

column4: when u but them all together

column6: the bulldozer and the firetruck) but who cares?"

column2: "My grandson loves it. it sits on his bed.  He loves dinosaurs and this was perfect for him. he couldn't have been  happier when he got it. and its a nice size. that he can enjoy it."

"My daughter (5) is quite the tea party buff. She has even been able to convince her two brothers to join her for tea parties and has thrown "official" tea parties for her friends. She was my official tester for this set. This set definitely has the cuteness factor you would expect in a tea set. It also food grade
column3: meaning you can put drinks (like lemonade) in the cups
column4: food on the plates
column5: etc. This is important because some manufacturers are stupid enough to put tea sets on the market using materials that aren't food grade - so kids can't really use them!The set worked well. Don't overfill the teapot or it can leak
column6: but this is still good for a "party".These are NOT dishwasher safe. Not a bad thing since clean up is a fun and important part of any tea party anyway (and washing dishes instead of just throwing them in the dishwasher should happen sometimes). They also should NOT have hot liquids or be placed in the microwave. Now
column7: this isn't a bad thing since this set is recommended for kids as young as 3 and I can't see serving a 3 year old tea with boiling water.We didn't quite get the "sunny patch" design. It has cute butterfly designs and the teapot is kind of a flower
column8: but for "Sunny Patch" we were thinking Mrs. Spider's Sunny Patch so we were kind of thrown off by that.Overall a really good tea set that a child can actually use (no BPA or PVC - THANK YOU!!!). Just be careful with it (no microwave
column9: no dishwasher) and it should last a long time!"

column2: "My daughter had one of these when she was smaller so I knew I wanted to get one for my neice's birthday. It arrived quickly. She loved it! Too bad the dog ate the balls rather quickly. They should send more or make an option to purchase more when ordering."

column3: but a couple of the pins don't easily stand up on their own

column2: "I originally bought this for my teenage son

column2: "I purchased two packs of these for two wonderful little girls' Christmas.  I manually sorted all the colors into individual compartments of Plano storage boxes (B000E3C3OE) so
column3: over the coarse of a couple of hours
column4: I handled pretty much every single band in the bag.  I did not count them so I can't comment on the accuracy of the number listed but the volume of the package seems consistent when compared to the smaller packs I have been buying.  No bad smells or anything to report as some others have mentioned but here are a few things of note;  Both bags were almost dead on with the amount of each color received.  Lots of green
column5: white
column6: black and orange.  Not so many red
column7: pink
column8: dark blue.  Other colors kind of average the others.  There seems to be a problem with the machine cutting the bands
column9: especially green and light blue.  Both packages help a large number of broken green bands and some that were still together but paper thin in one area.  Same with the light blue color.  Not as many broken but several thin ones in both bags.  Overall
column10: the sizes are fairly consistent but you'll occasionally run into a really thick one or a thinner than average one.  They still work fine for their purpose and both girls absolutely loved them.  That and the low
column11: low price add up to four stars from me.  If you're looking for a lot of bands for not a lot of money and you're not overly perfectionist

column2: "Like many of the other reviewers

column4: not a mask.  This isn't entirely a bad thing though--it means it will fit a variety of size people from kids to adults.It is comfortable to wear (at first) but quickly becomes a bit claustrophobic.As for the voice--I expected more.  The lines are delivered well and the sound quality is good but I was really hoping for a wider variety of phrases and maybe the ability to Vaderize your own voice but no luck there.Overall

column2: "Let me preface this review - I know NOTHING about Beyblade
column3: nor the accompanying cartoon.  There is a whole "cult" following around this game and all the different Blades.  Mostly young male.I chose this game because it looked cool and like something my 7 year old would like.  Well
column4: he LOVED it.  But we had to watch several YOUTUBE videos before we got the hang of ripping the tops.  The arena comes with three inter-changeable bottoms
column5: which make the tops behave differently
column6: so you can always be switching the play area up.  The tops I know
column7: I know
column8: they are Beyblades and the launcher contraptions - are solidly constructed of heavy aluminum and heavy plastic.  They are well made.  The arena?  NOT so much.  Cheap crappy plastic.  As are the rip-chord things.  This set comes with additional stickers
column9: directions and a score keeping pad for tournaments.This kit comes with the bottom of the rung top-launcher and that was the one issue I had.  It took me a lot of practice and watching the videos to see exactly how this thing worked.  So that's my big complaint - they could have thrown in two launcher guns.Now
column10: how did this game save the day?  My kids are in-between summer camps right now and stuck in horrible
column12: snoring daycare - literally a parking lot all day.  Very sad
column14: I know.  My son brought this game in and it was played with for HOURS by all ages - K through 6 and all kids
column15: everyone wanted to take a turn playing and they played it for over 4 hours.  The cheap crappy arena - held up brilliantly!  It didn't even have one scratch on it at the end of the day.  The tops?  Well
column16: they looked battled - but were perfectly fine.  All the kids enjoyed playing and watching the tournaments.  Some kids have slick moves - like sliding into the arena.  It made for a very fun morning in an otherwise stifling
column17: soul-sucking setting.I gave some stars for educational value because I think it teaches patience - your turn will come - and you also have to fill out the tournament diagrams - which is a bit like good old fashioned FINAL FOUR rankings.I might go ahead and add another two blades to the set - oh noooo
column18: I'm becoming a Beyblade cult member!"

column2: "Cute doctor kit and my almost 3 year old daughter loves it and has played with it constantly the two days she has had it.  All of the kit fits inside the bag

column4: cheap plastic and is very loud when hit against things.  I also hear
column5: "Mommy
column6: I need help!" several times a day because my daughter cannot open the bag on her own.  Happy to help
column7: but it should be easier for the younger ones to open it.  My daughter is happy though which is what matters most."

column2: "My 3.5 year old wanted one of these for months and we finally bought her one once she passed a milestone. It works easily and is in bed with her every night."
"This is different from the other Knight dress-up costumes because it's a set of molded plastic pieces.  My son wore it for Halloween
column3: and some thought he was a gladiator.  He actually wore it over a cheap fabric/mesh hooded top that was designed to look like chainmail
column4: so the effect of both put together was quite good.  He won a costume contest at a friend's party.  He loves the set
column5: and there are so many pieces that it's a great value--chest plate
column6: shield
column7: sword (with scabbard) and helmet.  If you had only one knight dress-up set
column8: this one will last. (I'm afraid to put the chainmail costume in the wash).DETAILS:  The chest plate has 2 plastic straps that go from the shoulder to the hip.  The strap attachment works like a backpack strap attachment--you feed the strap up and down through 2 horizontal slots.  Because the straps are plastic
column9: it is not easily adjustable
column10: and you can't tighten by simply pulling on the long tail once you've fed it through.  To keep it on a small child
column11: you should criss-cross the straps in the back
column13: it'd be too loose and difficult to keep on.  With the straps criss crossed
column14: it can be a little tricky to for a child to pull on over his head
column15: and if it's adjusted too tight
column16: the hard plastic will dig into the child's neck/collar bone.  Find a comfortably loose position
column17: and keep it there.  The straps won't slip.  Once we found the right length
column18: my 4 year old had no problem slipping it over his head by himself (and off again).  The helmet is too large for most children.  I rigged a ribbon chin strap with just a little elastic on the ends
column19: and it was enough to keep the helmet from falling off."

"My 5-year old grandson really likes it.Fisher-Price TRIO DC Super Friends BatcaveBut there's no way he could assemble it himself.  The instructions (all pictures
column3: which is good) involve 50 steps.  We worked together on the first half
column4: but then his interest in the assembly process decreased .  (Of course
column5: I had to see it all the way through.) Plus
column6: some of the snap-together parts (the yellow rods in the picture) take a fair bit of strength to snap in
column7: especially when the connection point is horizontal. And attaching the final parts (the top section with the Bat signal) can cause some other parts to come loose
column8: because the structure can't take a lot of downward pressure.I didn't even try any of the alternate configurations.  As others have said
column9: the booklet shows pictures

column2: "Cupid is a myth – not a fairytale – and her purpose is to help others find love.  C.A. Cupid has made the jump from a minor Monster High character to an Ever After High Rebel – and I am so glad she did.  This doll is a beautiful addition to the EAH lineup.  Cupid is all about pink
column3: and her other colors are white
column4: bronze and black.  Cupid has bright turquoise blue eyes that are enhanced by her metallic pink eye makeup and long lashes.  A cute detail she has is that her eyes also have white heart-shaped highlights.  Her lips are pale pink with a darker pink heart painted on the middle.  Her long
column5: curled pink hair and curled bangs are the same bright pink shade as her MH version
column6: and the pink shade is quite a bit more intense than it appears in the promotional photo.  Her styling and expression are very sweet and less severe than the MH version.  Cupid is a darling.Cupid is the daughter of Eros
column7: the winged god of love
column8: so feather and heart details abound.  Her dress has a pink halter top with little metallic bronze wing cap details over her shoulders.  The skirt of her dress is a print of pink sky and white clouds overlaid with metallic pink heart tipped arrows.  The skirt is trimmed in black lace
column9: and the top and front of the dress have a transparent bronze net apron.  Cupid also wears black fishnet stockings and gold winged high heel shoes.Cupid has many accessories
column10: but the best are her removable wings.  The wings are white with bronze antiquing to bring out the pattern of the feathers.  The wings hang from the back of her neck by a collar that is shaped like an arrow.  Cupid holds her bronze bow and filigree covered quiver of arrows.  She wears black heart shaped earrings
column14: and a bronze headband with a pink heart and arrow decoration.Cupid comes with a doll stand
column15: key shaped hair brush and fold out “bookmark” bio with details of her story.  Cupid is fully jointed
column16: and can be posed multiple ways for play or display. Cupid is made for gentle play and has several small parts that could be damaged or lost if care is not taken with her.  She comes in the usual amazing EAH packaging that is styled to look like a storybook and displays her tagline
column17: “Loves a Happily Ever After”.  Cupid is a beautiful fashion doll that will be loved by Ever After High and Monster High fans alike."

column2: "There is a good reason why this toy is still popular more than 50 years later. It requires a variety of skills to make it work -- creativity
column3: hand-eye coordination
column4: technical understanding
column5: and patience. And yet
column6: somebody lacking any or all of those skills can still play with it. Anybody can doodle aimlessly on an etch a sketch
column7: but with practice you can make something really special. And then
column8: with just a shake
column9: it disappears forever
column10: as if it never was! There is something mysterious and magic about that whole concept
column11: which is part of the fun. This is a toy
column12: it is a skill development tool
column13: and it is an artistic canvas. There is nothing else quite like it. It reminds you that art
column16: and if you can't find a philosophical meaning in the whole thing
column17: then you might as well just shake it up and have fun with it. Gotta love the Etch a Sketch."

column2: "While this toy looks like a pretty good hybrid for angry birds and K'Nex lovers
column3: you'll spend more time cleaning it up and setting it up then playing with it.  The beauty of Angry Birds is that you can destroy without the consequences of cleaning up after yourself.  This toy has me sympathizing with the pigs

column7: and they enjoy K'Nex
column8: they gave up on this one fairly quickly."

column3: but don't be fooled!  Especially once a lot of the letters are off the board and you have to really dig to get a word that contains a letter you need!"

column2: "BRIO Pull Along Frog  is a small toy but fun. It makes a hopping motion when it is pulled along the floor. It is very sturdy
column3: and truly durable.  Children love it.  It is very colorful and well-made.  I was a little concerned about the pull string being a strangle hazard
column4: but it’s fine.  I recommend this high-quality toy."

column2: "I purchased this as a  gift for a friend's daughter's 2nd year birthday.  She was very happy with the present so I take that as a good thing."
"brought two of these.  read review after review and was worried about it popping. my two boys are 6 and 10 and the same size (4'2" & 4'4" and forget their weight
column3: but wear size 10-12 boys to give you an idea).  I got this a few days ago (thank you PRIME shipping!) and the 6yr old tried it out first.  he went flying a few times into the carpet
column4: but got the hang of it within a half hour.  he loved it..was absolutely out of breath
column5: so i know it was a workout.  his brother got to hop on his the next day and same thing...got the hang of it in short time.  well
column6: that's all the did the rest of the weekend was hop
column7: hop
column8: hop back and forth....racing
column9: fighting
column10: picking it up by the handle and smacking each other...from p in the morning til 9 at night.  buyer beware!  lolonly con was that the balls were greasy out of the box.  and smelly.  i had read it on some of the reviews.  i just wiped them down with a couple clorox wipes before i let them play on them.blowing them up was pretty easy.  i found that using my mouth got it pumped up faster than the ball pump (that i had on my own).  but i used the ball pump to top it off before sealing.i'm sure we'll have lots more fun with these.  and if they pop
column11: i think it'll be worth it to reorder another."

column2: "This Snow White is great for younger girls. My 3 year old granddaughter loves Disney Princesses & asked for Snow White for her birthday.Disney Princess Princess Snow White Dollis from  the Disney Sparkling Princess collection by Mattel.She is the size of a Barbie.She can't stand alone; however her legs move at the hips.  Her knees don't bend.The front of her bodice is  sparkly
column3: molded plastic
column4: but the back of her molded plastic bodice is not sparkly.Snow White's hair is very stiff & shouldn't get messed up easily.Her shoes will not stay on.  We're thinking of using double-sided sticky tape to see that will work. If that doesn't work
column5: we might glue the shoes on...then again
column6: we might forget about the shoes & let Snow White go barefoot.Her skirt can be removed; the top piece of her skirt is sparkly.Snow White has a plastic tiara that seems like it can't be pulled off. Granddaughter's sleeping with Snow White now
column7: so I can't check.Snow White's face is much prettier than it looks in Amazon's photo. Actually she looks better in person than in the product photo.Sparkling Princess Snow White seems to be durable & is a good choice for a 3 year old who loves all the Disney princesses."

column2: "Nice sand art
column3: though glow in the dark aspect is subtle at best. Still a pretty piece. My child enjoys it in the bedroom. Be sure to note size
column4: as it is on the smaller side."

column2: "I'm not a good predictor of what kinds of toys our 19-month-old son would enjoy. He won't touch some things and immediately falls in love with others. Well
column3: his grandparents gave him this Leapfrog Alphabet Pal and he took an immediate like to it. He even sleeps with it! And it's hard plastic. Go figure. His main attraction is with the musical tunes. He has learned to switch the selection to music and he then plays the tunes with the little buttons. So far
column4: there's no action in the other modes
column5: but he loves the music.Gary Peterson"

column2: "Bugs are quality and preserved well.  Kids like looking at them with a magnifying glass.  I gave 4 stars because the acrylic scratches fairly easily
column3: but the kit should last if you protect it."

column2: "This is the Stormtrooper/Sandtrooper we've been waiting for. great sculpt
column3: perfect dimensions
column4: no more "He-Man" stormtroopers
column5: looks totally screen accurate. the removable head to get the shoulder pauldron off is a great addition as you can strip it down for double duty as a harder to find stormtrooper
column6: or paint the pauldron for a custom squad of individual sandtroopers. the accessories are great with good detail on the weathered weapons and the backpack. if you only get one figure from the black series
column7: make it a Sandtrooper."

column2: "I used these in birthday party gift bags
column3: and the kids loved them.. They are pretty sturdy and just the right size for toddler hands.I will order these again!"

column2: "The toy sounded like a great idea.  My kids love music
column3: toys that make noise and they also love coloring
column4: so this would be the perfec toy for them
column5: right? Not so much.The brand name is reliable. The idea is cute. You can make sounds while coloring.  I didn't mind having to put batteries in the toy. I have three boys so I'm immune to the noise.  The coloring pages are adorable. I'm just not sure what went wrong.They (referring to my 3 & 6 year-old sons) played with the toy as intended for about 5 minutes.  That's it.  They they took the coloring pages to the dining room table and had a blast coloring them.  The board sits in a toy bin and has not been touched since the day it arrived.My advice is to make sure this is something your child really wants before spending money on it...even at a sale price. Even at 75% off.  In my case printing out coloring pages from the internet is more exciting to my boys than the sound board."

column2: "This is really cute.  You can 'teach' it tricks and play two games with it.  One is a memory game
column3: the other a reflex one.  It makes barking noises and plays two loud songs over and over
column4: fyi for parents with frayed nerves.  After playing each game once
column5: I was done.  I give it 3 stars because when you turn it off
column6: it 'forgets' the tricks you taught it (unlike a Furby)
column7: making that part of it seem pointless."

column2: "{{{As of today
column3: August 25 2013
column4: this exclusive Headmistress Bloodgood Set is a 'red hot deal' this week at Toys R Us for almost half off (available both in-store and online) making this a GREAT deal at $27.99
column5: plus tax and shipping which would bring your total to around $37 and change.}}} I was completely swept up in the preordering frenzy
column6: mistakenly thinking that this set would be only sold by TRU online
column7: and not only was I wrong
column8: but I could have saved a little money by waiting for the sale this week!!!  Wish I would have waited to catch this on sale (as well as the new Home Ick and Mad Science sets discounted last week)
column9: but oh well...We've owned this set since it was released in May and my kiddo and I both feel that Headmistress Bloodgood is an amazing doll
column10: great quality as is deserved of any MH product. Taller than the average girl dolls
column11: and with enough detail to her coat and the rest of her outfit. Her up-do will stay in place nicely
column12: but of course if you're a collector you will keep her in the box anyway. Nightmare is a gorgeous horse with an equally lovely saddle and has had no problems withstanding hours of playtime.The only reason why this exclusive set isn't a full five stars is the lack of accessories. I LOVE the fact that there is another 'grown up' doll offered in the MH line
column13: BUT there is no doll stand
column14: no brush for either the doll or horse
column17: Nightmare seems like she was molded from discarded Barbie horse molds (we did a side by side comparison with a Barbie horse
column18: but another reviewer pointed out the mold is from the Disney Princess horse line). These two characters deserve a better package presentation! Since this set retails well over what past offered sets have
column19: I hoped Mattel and TRU would really wow fans. Love the Headmistress and glad I purchased
column20: but kind of disappointed in the presentation especially for the price.  Definitely a MUST BUY at the sale price
column21: but sadly not worth paying full retail plus shipping."

column2: "My boys who are 2 and 4 love these ratchet racers. They are easy to use...NO BATTERIES to deal with. They are easy to wind and I would say the frustration factor is pretty low on this toy. My boys are not the most patient
column3: long-term attention grabbing crowd. You have to hit them fast and hard with the toy's "how's it work
column4: what does it do and is it fun?" If you can't get them in the first 60 seconds. Fugettaboutit. This toy managed to do it and held their attention long enough for me to cook a meal
column5: so it's a winner in my house! Bravo!"

column2: "This shoots very far. That is part of the fun of this gun. It shoots much further than most nerf guns.It is very easy to use and very intuitive.it is easy to load and easy to cock and easy to shoot. Like most nerf guns though
column3: it is not accurate beyond a short distance.However
column4: the one draw back on this gun is it seems to jam easier than many other nerf guns we own
column5: and with two boys you can imagine we own quite a few nerf guns.The good news is there is this little handy orange dot on the side of the nerf gun by the trigger
column6: you push on it and it unjams the bullet. It seems to work for us with very little problems.Because it shoots so far you have to imagine there is some power behind the shot. Part of the reason the darts shoot so far is they are very light. However
column7: as several of us can attest to after being hit
column8: if you are hit up close by one of these darts it can sting quite a bit. You would absolutely not want to be hit in the face with one of these at close quarters.Buy extra darts."

column2: "I took it out of the box and tried to change the rows from flush to staggered to make the rubber band bracelet
column3: and it broke immediately. On the other hand
column4: it broke in such a way
column5: that it is still useable. There are blue parts that allow the user to hold the loom together and add more looms to make more complex projects
column6: and there are enough of these to hold the loom together even if it is broken. Decent mix of band colors included in the 600 enclosed. I'm still using it. Gives me something to do with my child who is enjoying another loom. And since I got it at Amazon for $3.60
column7: what can I expect
column8: right? If I had paid full price
column9: I would have been mad

column2: "This was a gift from an older relative for my 7yo daughter
column3: and I suspect that all the other kids in the extended family of the under the age of 10 received this as well.  Daughter enjoyed this set because it was a novel project and she loves markers.  Additionally the clear markers allow the kids to see capillary action and offers an opportunity for explaining the science behind the ink getting sucked into the marker base.We did not like the mess factor - we are almost ready to list our home for sale
column4: including new neutral colored carpet
column5: freshly painted trim and doors - and more
column6: you get the idea.  Wish the relative would have taken this into account and waited until next Christmas to give this gift - it can be messy with the 3 bottles of non-permanent/but NOT washable ink.  The instruction page does indicate that the ink can stain.  Additionally
column7: I felt that the ink colors were less vibrant than regular markers.Also
column8: the ink was hard for daughter to squeeze into the measuring tubes.  Crayola wisely used durable plastic bottles with thicker plastic
column9: but does make it hard for the younger ones to squeeze and therefore
column10: we adults took on this task.  Also
column11: putting the final bottom cap on was also difficult for 7yo to complete - she could get the first click
column12: but never the final click to completely seal it shut.  We adults also helped with this.  The mechanism for this task (a lever) works well
column13: but little kids have less leverage and strength.  Maybe would have been easier on the floor or a lower table.We will not keep the set and do not plan on refills as we are minimizing stuff in prep for a move and do not desire the potential mess.  Overall
column14: a decent product that many kids would enjoy - just maybe not the parents."

column2: "This game by GMT is a winner
column3: a gamer's game to use the cliche. It's breathtaking and
column4: simply put
column5: the best boardgame I ever played.However
column6: make no mistake: if it has a scoring track running along all four sides of the game board
column7: this is a Eurogame at heart :)This is not a licensed product developed in German and translated to English. It was designed by GMT (Chad Jansen).And what a game this is. Full of options for the players to decide each turn (that's the main reason the games lasts more than three hours
column8: I guess)
column9: a fantastic theme (the Ice Age is coming! Which species will survive?)
column10: gorgeous components (mainly in the new 3rd printing released June 2012)
column11: clear and explicit rule book. And what's best: six players can play it
column12: a rare fact indeed for this kind of strategy game.There is some "screwing another player" factor in this game. So
column13: people who don'tlike a certain level of confrontation may be put aside by it. But even so
column14: you may ty to avoi d it in a reasonable basis and still win. But tototally avoid the confrontationwould mean sure defeat.A fter all
column15: this is indeed a battle amongst species.DOMINANT SPECIES has all the fun of a great strategy game
column16: without any really negative side. However
column17: one must be prepared to spend between three-four hours of playing. As it is the case with the majority of games of this type
column18: the experience of playing it is highly enhanced iy you play it with the full capacity of players allowed (in this case
column19: six players).I'd also recommend to never try to play this game with people who are new to Eurogames or this kind of strategy game. It would be better to begin with a simpler game (like STONE AGE or VIKINGS)
column20: then try DOMINANT SPECIES another day."

column2: "My son got this for his 10th birthday and he LOVES IT
column3: we LOVE IT and everyone who plays it LOVES IT!  I would HIGHLY recommend this toy"

column2: "I bought this as a Christmas gift for my son thinking he and my brother can build it together. I took all the peices out of the box and after about 45 minutes of frustration they went back in and havent come back out. The directions arent clear at all."

"We received the LeapFrog Learn & Groove Musical table from a friend.  From the minute my daughter saw it she was playing with it all the time.  It is sturdy enough that she can hold onto it while playing with the different items.  There are lots of different sounds and items to play with.  All around a great toy."
"My boys love plastic animals
column3: and I love the Wild Republic sets.  This set comes with six different sharks
column4: all of which look great
column5: especially for the price.  What a fun way to teach children about the natural world."

column2: "My 2 year old LOVES Disney Planes so this was awesome. We love Duplo! Goes great with Dusty and Chug set."
"Great gift
column3: I bought it for my grand daughter she wore her first one out.  She plays with it all the time baby dolls stuffed aminals groceries everything goes for a ride. She really likes it for all her adventures."

column2: "Fun
column3: quick game.  I play this game with my 9-year-old daughter.  There is some strategy but enough randomness that anyone can win no matter the age differences.I actually wish the game would take a little longer because some games can be over in minutes depending upon which cards are drawn.  However
column4: this is also good because this is one of those games you can play when you don't want to play a long game.  I don't think we have ever went over 10 minutes for someone to win this game (and probably not that long).I have never played with other than two players
column5: but I think 3 or 4 players would probably make the game even better.Edit:  After playing this more with various peoples
column6: it appears that at some point it just digresses into a person trying to make a straight line across the board and stopping his opponent from beating him by using cards to remove opponent markers.  At this point it just becomes a luck of the draw kind of game.  And then the game gets played less and less."

column2: "My 10 year old loves putting this together and we super glued it so we wouldn't have to worry about the flying lego toy crashing into many pieces.Thanks!"
"Every useful for fruit
column3: dessert and finger food! Must have for only $3 compared to $7 at lo cal stores!"

column2: "This game was 2 hours of non stop laughs. Someone literally peed their pants from laughing.You must purchase this game at all costs!"
"i like how it comes in individually wrapped activity sets.  however
column3: there's not enough stuff or beginners.  there were couple things that were easy to do. but the rest are hard
column4: even for my almost 4yo daughter who loves to cut.  she got frustrated at the little things that she had to cut...I feel like my daughter can master 1/2 of the stuff here
column5: which she wants more of and i wish i could just buy those easy ones only.overall colorful & nice."

column2: "Dynamic Duo Funhouse Escape
column3: or Joker's Funhouse
column4: is an excellent Super Heroes set for the value. The Price per Brick ratio is fantastic
column5: and it includes 5 main characters Batman
column6: Robin
column7: Joker
column8: Riddler
column9: and Harley Quinn. The play features on this set are above and beyond expectations. A coaster like cart ride
column11: and even an extra Riddler head! This is a Toys R Us exclusive but if you don't have a TRU you can find it at Amazon. Brick and Mortar Lego Stores don't carry it but you can find it online.Of all the Super Heroes playsets being released in 2012 (including the Marvel line) Dynamic Duo Funhouse Escape is the most creative
column13: and engaging Super hero set true to film
column15: and television. This will provide your Children with hours of playtime. Seriously
column16: kids can't stop playing with this set.. there is something timeless about it."

column2: "It is hard to find a game that my entire family can sit down with and enjoy. Either game is aimed at the younger members or our family
column3: or it is better for the older members. Usually the grown ups have to give in to the kids. But now we have Hedbanz and we all have a great time playing it.The rules are simple: ask questions of the other players until you guess "what you are". Older players will tend to ask better questions
column4: but younger players will have much sillier questions and answers that can really throw the adults off track!Of course
column5: it is hard not to be silly when you have a card strapped to your forehead by a bright blue plastic band. We all had a blast! Sometimes it pays to be only 7 ask simple questions that lead you right to the answer. At other times
column6: an adult can get themselves way off track. It was a ton of fun and this is our new game night favorite.We do have one complaint though: it only comes with 75 cards. You'll probably only go through 20 or so cards in a 4 person game
column7: but this still means that you will start seeing the same cards after your 3rd game. No such a big problem for kids
column8: but if you have 2 adults playing the games could start to get repetitive after a while.Overall
column9: I highly recommend this game for a family or group with a broad age range. Everyone will have fun and can play at their own skill level."

column2: "Are you kidding.  Kids love this stuff.  They can spend hours and hours making their pretend meals and of course all the adults are served whatever they ask for.  Great FUN and imagination."

"BUY THIS NOW!  I have a say one thing that this is a super gift. At only $30 at the time of writing this review it's really a steal to get such a nice stuffed animal/dinosaur at that price. To me I think it's high quality from my perspective but that remains to be seen how long it will last when a child plays with it. I got it for my three are old nephew because I want to be the cool uncle that got them something really awesome. The one thing I love is how big it is my hope is that he remembers it when he gets bigger like I remember some of my toys.So basically if you have a kid who loves dinosaurs this really is one of the coolest present I found on Amazon. And the box it comes in is pretty gigantic.Thanks for reading!"

"My 1 year old was awake when I was putting out Santa gifts and this was his. He squealed when he saw it and came over and took it and started loving on it. I love how soft and adorable it is and nothing on it worries me as a choking hazard. I hope he will start sleeping with it but if not it is still a great toy."
"For the money I think this is pretty well built
column3: attractive furniture. It looks really nice in my dollhouse dining room."

column2: "My niece loved this toy. It's even a good toy to play with the pet cat. It's just a little hard to get it to turn. I give this toy five stars."
"Love LeapFrog products.  This workbook has helped my son learn how to write numbers.  It also has helped him with pronunciation of the words."
"This game is as raunchy as advertised! If you can find humor in stealing cookies from an AIDS bake sale (one of the cards)
column3: then you will enjoy this game. If you find that highly offensive (and lots of people understandably will) then stick with apples to apples. It is definitely for a certain audience
column4: and choose your company carefully! Once that is out of the way
column5: get ready to laugh
column6: and laugh and laugh and then cry. We have played this with many different groups
column7: and it is outstanding fun.Repeats are rare as the combos are almost endless. We also got the first expansion
column8: which is great and even raunchier! The randomness and variety is the best part
column9: to see what your friends come up with Example: Q: what was Michael Jackson's dying thoughts? A: switching to Geico.  Unfortunately some of the answers only fit with a handful of cards
column10: and I find the expansion helps with this."

column2: "Purchased this for my granddaughter for Christmas. This is very nice and just the right size for a 3 year old."
"I got it for my 3 year old for her birthday

"Wife bought these to put on our kids birthday cake so it would look pretty and it gave her an excuse to buy the kid more toys. It is what it is and it s just exactly that."
"Love these characters. Some are appropriate for younger children and some may not be. Personally I bought one for a six yo and one for a twenty six yo. Love the colors
column3: Love the macabre playmates.I think I might need one too."

column2: "My daughter is 4.5 years old and loves using my iPhone to take pictures so I thought I would buy her a camera of her own. I was looking for something pink
column3: durable and cheap. This fit the bill perfectly.Of coarse the LCD is super small and it's response time is extremely laggy (slow) but overall my daughter loves the camera. Comes with USB cable and quick framing of pictures. Flash works decently as well.Overall a good buy a child. My daughter loves it."

column2: "this is sturdy and nice the only thing is as some of the dinos there equipment snaps on or fits snug. this one the attachments are always falling off."
"This toy is really entertaining for my son who is disabled and extremely durable
